title.narrative: Soudan du Sud (le): Aide ciblée aux pays
South Sudan: Targeted country assistance

description.narrative:
Plans d’assistance technique ciblée aux pays L’assistance technique ciblée aux pays (TCA) est octroyée sous forme de ressources destinées aux partenaires présents dans les pays. La TCA est un élément du cadre d’engagement avec les partenaires (PEF) de Gavi. Le plan de TCA d’un pays est établie selon les besoins exprimés du dit pays lors de l’évaluation conjointe. Un plan comprend une liste d’activités, d’étapes clés, et un budget pour une année dite. L’assistance technique est un soutien non financier fourni par des spécialistes. Elle peut revêtir plusieurs formes : partage d’information et de savoir-faire, formation et services-conseils.
L’assistance technique fournie dans le cadre du PEF est appelée aide ciblée aux pays. Ce type de soutien vise principalement à payer le personnel basé en permanence dans les bureaux pays des partenaires. Il repose sur la demande et les besoins identifiés par les pays eux-mêmes.

Targeted country assistance (TCA) are resources provided to in-country partners under Gavi’s partners’ engagement framework (PEF). A country’s TCA plan is based on needs expressed by the country during the joint appraisal discussions. It includes sets of activities, milestones and budget for a given year.Technical assistance is non-financial support provided by specialists. It can take the form of sharing information and expertise, training and consulting services.
The technical assistance provided through PEF is called targeted country assistance (TCA). This type of support mainly consists of staff permanently based in partners’ country offices. It is based on the demand and needs identified by the countries themselves.

title.narrative: Partners' engagement framework

description.narrative: Through the partners’ engagement framework, Vaccine Alliance partners support countries’ immunisation activities

condition.narrative: Conditions are detailed in the Partners’ engagement framework
Les conditions sont détaillées dans le cadre d'engagement des partenaires

title.narrative: UNICEF : Supply Chain & Procurement

1. Development process of automated mobile technologies for tracking realtime stock visibility started covering: *Preparation of standard requirements for automated LMIS Tools *Development and testing of mobile technologies for stock management *Piloting at national, states, 10 counties and document lessons for scale-up
2. Comprehensive EVMA recommendation implementation status reviewed and EVM IP updated accordingly.

target.value: Improve vaccine stock management at national and sub-national level; inistitute processes, procedures and technologies to ensure vaccine availability and stock visibility

comment.narrative: 1. Development of automated mobile technologies for tracking real-time stock situation was not prioritized/considered for Gavi TCA for 2020. In the meantime, UNICEF South Sudan CO is working with UNICEF Supply Division to pilot automated SMT, which is currently under development, starting in the third quarter of 2021. The new, automated SMT will replace existing excel based tool and allow wider deployment at sub-national level. 2. A comprehensive EVM assessment was conducted in mid-2019 covering the national vaccine stores, eight state cold chain stores, 14 county cold chain stores, and 15 service delivery points. The assessment highlighted key areas of strength and weakness in the immunization supply chain system. The findings also informed the development of multi-year EVM Improvement Plan for all levels of the immunization supply chain. The recommendations are prioritized to chart implementation timeline and shared for adoption at all vaccine storage and service delivery points. Informed by the EVM Assessment report, concerted efforts are made to expand and replace cold chain capacities at levels of the supply chain system. More than 850 Fridge-tags were procured and deployed throughout the country. Sensitization of cold chain workers at vaccine stores and health workers at service delivery points is currently ongoing, technical and material supports are being provided to ensure implementation of the recommendations.

target.value: Improve vaccine stock management at national and sub-national level; inistitute processes, procedures and technologies to ensure vaccine availability and stock visibility

comment.narrative: 1. Development of automated mobile technologies for tracking real-time stock situation was not prioritized/considered for Gavi TCA for 2020. In the meantime, UNICEF South Sudan CO is working with UNICEF Supply Division to pilot automated SMT, which is currently under development, starting in the third quarter of 2021. The new, automated SMT will replace existing excel based tool and allow wider deployment at sub-national level. 2. A comprehensive EVM assessment was conducted in mid-2019 covering the national vaccine stores, eight state cold chain stores, 14 county cold chain stores, and 15 service delivery points. The assessment highlighted key areas of strength and weakness in the immunization supply chain system. The findings also informed the development of multi-year EVM Improvement Plan for all levels of the immunization supply chain. The recommendations are prioritized to chart implementation timeline and shared for adoption at all vaccine storage and service delivery points. Informed by the EVM Assessment report, concerted efforts are made to expand and replace cold chain capacities at levels of the supply chain system. More than 850 Fridge-tags were procured and deployed throughout the country. Sensitization of cold chain workers at vaccine stores and health workers at service delivery points is currently ongoing, technical and material supports are being provided to ensure implementation of the recommendations.

title.narrative: John Snow, Inc. : Financial/General Management
Subnational level: JSI to support states in TWG meetings. Priority states have functional TWGs (have agenda items, clear meeting minutes, action items)

target.value: Subnational level: Support priority SMOH in strengthening functionality of coordination platforms/Mechanism at state level (EPI Coordination Committee meetings)

comment.narrative: 9 states conducted at least 2 TWG meetings between January and April 2021. Some planned meetings were not conducted due to competing priorities (like immunization campaigns). JSI supported states with TWG meetings by ensuring that the agenda addressed zero dose and missed children and that identified action items had a timeline and responsible person(s) to facilitate decision-making.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Service Delivery
Number of children under one that have received penta-3 vaccination increased by 10% from 2020 achievement in conflict affected states.

target.value: 4. Support delivery of immunization services in conflict affected states

comment.narrative: Immunization services are provided on a regular basis through static, outreach and mobile sessions integrated with other health services. In Jonglei and Upper Nile, total of 191 health facilities are currently providing immunization service. Despite the severe flooding and population displacement in many counties of Jonglei and Upper Nile, the number of children that have received all the three doses of Pentavalent vaccine between January and September 2021 has reached 47,675. This is 13% increment compared to the same time period in 2020.

title.narrative: All FER supported health facilities provide immunization service through static, outreach and mobile services

target.value: 4. Support delivery of immunization services in conflict affected states

comment.narrative: Immunization services are provided on regular basis through static, outreach and mobile sessions integrated with other health services provided through the WB PEHSP Project. The number of under one children in South Sudan that are vaccinated with Penta-3 and Measles from January to April 2021, has reached 126,215 and 106,123 respectively. Penta 3 coverage for the same time period has increased from 57% reported for 2020 to 69% (April 2021-annualized reporting rate) The Penta-1 to Penta-3 dropout rate decreased from 18% for Jan to Apr 2020 to 15% for 2021. The Measles coverage for Jan to Apr, annualized, has increased from 51% in 2020 to 58% for 2021. In Jonglei and Upper Nile, the number of under children under one that have received Penta-3 from Jan to Apr has shown an increment of 35% in 2021 compared to the same period in 2020. Currently, 185 health facilities in Jonglei and Upper Nile are providing immunization services through static, outreach and mobile strategies. From Jan to April 2021, 96 vaccinators were trained on immunization in practice through formal training sessions.

title.narrative: John Snow, Inc. : Data
Data on HSS/FER activity implementation continues to be entered into the database and tracked using the HSS/FER operationalization framework database.

target.value: Support the MoH & partners in migrating quarterly HSS review data to the HSS/FER operationalization platforms master database.

comment.narrative: JSI continued to enter and track data in the operationalization/accountability framework, which is now in the advanced stage of development. The framework has all the agreed indicators to be monitored to date. The corresponding output data is being analyzed by selected indicators for MoH decision-making. JSI and partners are exploring ways to include data elements/indicators that do not have electronic sources (i.e. are not being reported through DHIS2), to be included in analysis. JSI worked with a multi-agency stakeholder committee from HPF, UNICEF, WHO and IOM to advance this work under MOH leadership.

title.narrative: John Snow, Inc. : Demand Promotion & ACSM

Ongoing partnerships with media houses are maintained; periodic journalist briefings on immunization programme and radio talk shows organized for MoH & partners; quarterly EPI bulletins produced for public dissemination.

target.value: Support MOH in sustaining partnerships with the media to improve external communication on immunization through periodic journalist engagement/briefing, quarterly EPI Bulletin and other media outlets, including organizing radio talk shows for MoH and partners to increase advocacy and awareness on immunization and increase demand

comment.narrative: JSI supported the MoH in coordinating and scheduling radio talk shows, circulating the topic for discussion to the invited guests before each talk show and engaged the media houses in all the immunization activities conducted by MoH and its partners. The series of radio talk shows were aimed to create demand for immunization services and educate the community on the benefits of completing the child immunization schedule. In addition, JSI invited all media houses to participate in covering press releases on immunization activities. Furthermore, JSI Communication Consultant and JSI team produced a comprehensive EPI quarterly bulletin that showcased the prominent immunization activities, events, and data for Q1 2021.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Supply chain
Vaccine distribution plan prepared is being used for timely deliveries

target.value: 2. Support MOH in timely development of vaccine and supplies' forecast, procurement and distribution planning

comment.narrative: 1. Vaccine forecast prepared jointly by MOH and UNICEF for 2021. 2. Vaccine procurement initiated timely to ensure sufficient stocks at different levels to prevent "Stock-out " situation. 3. Vaccines are distributed from National level to states/selected counties on quarterly basis. In line with EVM Improvement Plan and good distribution practices, distribution plan for vaccines and immunization supplies, informed by utilization trends and stock in hand, is prepared and deployed at vaccine storage points. 4. Vaccines are transported from national vaccine store to 10 state cold chain hubs and over 20 counties using air transportation (UNHAS or chartered flights)

title.narrative: Cold chain equipment installed and commissioned following the deployment plan.

target.value: 3. Support cold chain extension, repair & and replacement activities.

comment.narrative: Cold chain equipment supplied through CCEOP and other mechanisms transported from the national level to sites of installation in time. Team of cold chain technicians at national and sub-national level were deployed throughout the country to conduct installation and commissioning of the cold chain equipment. South Sudan has concluded implementation of the CCEOP project for Year 2. From January to July 2021, 118 solar fridges procured through the GAVI CCEOP project have been successfully installed and commissioned. From January to October 2021, a total of 62 solar fridges have been procured and installed through non-GAVI financial resources. In addition, 43 malfunctioning fridges and generators were maintained/repaired. All installation, maintenance and repair activities are systematically documented using the CCE inventory dashboard managed at national level. The number of service delivery points with functional CCE has increased from 757 by the start of the year to 867 by 31 October 2021. Furthermore, UNICEF in collaboration with WB is currently assessing feasibility of health facility solar electrification to power key hospital functions including the maternity ward and operating theatre.

title.narrative: LMIS Tools distributed to states, counties and health facilities.

target.value: 1. Improve vaccine stock management, vaccine availability and visibility at national, state and county level.

comment.narrative: Existing vaccine control book, issue vouchers and temperature monitoring charts are reviewed/revised and approved by the logistic technical working group in a more simplified and user-friendly presentation. More than 1,000 copies of all the tools have been printed and distributed to states, counties and health facilities for ensuring vaccine visibility at all levels. Online tools for vaccine requisition and stock level reporting are developed and circulated for wider utilization. SMT and ViVa tools are used at national vaccine stores for recording vaccine transaction and monitoring of stock levels. Continued supportive supervision and on-the-job training is done to improve understanding of health workers/vaccine handlers regarding proper utilization of the LMIS Tools.

title.narrative: All (100%) state cold chain hubs and at least 30% of counties submit monthly vaccine stock balances.

target.value: 1. Improve vaccine stock management, vaccine availability and visibility at national, state and county level.

comment.narrative: Monitoring of the stock situation and improvement of stock management practices is currently ongoing. SMT and ViVa tools are used at national level for stock monitoring and inventory management. Under the guidance of UNICEF Supply Division, South Sudan has actively participated in eSMT development and testing process. South Sudan is pioneer country in piloting eSMT in the world. The tool will be deployed both at national and state level, and will then be cascaded to county level. Currently, vaccine stock level at state level is reported to national level on monthly basis. State level reporting has been consistent with all state cold chain hubs reporting their vaccine and dry supplies stock on monthly basis.

title.narrative: Mapping of cold chain facilities finalized and deployment plan for new cold chain equipment prepared and implementation started.

target.value: 3. Support cold chain extension, repair & and replacement activities.

comment.narrative: The cold chain system remain the bedrock of the immunization programme in South Sudan. In recent years, major improvement in the cold chain landscape was recorded, mainly due to CCEOP and other similar interventions. In 2020, 162 CCE were installed. From January to May 2021, additional 180 CCE were installed. South Sudan has successfully implemented two rounds of CCEOP (CCEOP Yr I & Yr II), were about 478 CCE were installed at counties and health facilities. This cold chain extension, expansion and replacement efforts have resulted in increase of cold chain coverage in South Sudan from 757 health facilities in December 2020 to 864 by end of May 2021. Cold chain inventory dashboard is updated regularly to reflect the new changes. Mapping of cold chain availability and gap was done to identify areas where additional support will be needed.

title.narrative: Vaccine and supplies' forecast jointly prepared, endorsed and procurement initiated

target.value: 2. Support MOH in timely development of vaccine and supplies' forecast, procurement and distribution planning

comment.narrative: Vaccines and immunization suppplies forecast for the year 2022 is jointly prepared with MOH and other technical partners, reviewed and endorsed by the MOH

title.narrative: WHO : Leadership, management, and coordination (LMC)
100% of NITAG meetings held and 50% of NITAG recommendations implemented

target.value:
Facilitate at least 2 SSITAG meetings
Support 1 field assessment by SSITAG members based on issues that emanate from discussion or requested by EPI team/ICC

comment.narrative: Meetings (SSITAG) held in Sept and Dec 2020 for discussion and endorsements of nOPV2, IPVS and COVID 19 vaccines introduction, however next meeting planned for 24 June 2021

title.narrative: 100% of NITAG meetings held and 75% of NITAG recommendations implemented

target.value:
Facilitate at least 2 SSITAG meetings
Support 1 field assessment by SSITAG members based on issues that emanate from discussion or requested by EPI team/ICC

comment.narrative: The South Sudan Immunization Technical Advisory Group (SSITAG) conducted two (2) meetings in 2021. The first meeting was in June 2021, to discuss and endorse Measles Follow up Campaign application, to be submitted to Gavi. the meeting was started by presentation of routine immunization updates, COVID -19 updates and the measles follow up campaign application. The SSITAG members deliberated on the presented updates, the raised questions were discussed and replied to by the EPI team. After the discussions, the core members endorse the document. The Minutes of the meeting attached. The second SSITAG meeting was in November 2021, to discuss plans for membership renewal. This is because the current members term has ended and there is necessity to renew the membership and vacate to allow bringing in of new members. It is worth to mention that the beginning of year 2021 witnessed changes in the Ministry of Health. The new Minister and the Undersecretary are to be oriented on EPI structure, including the bodies that support the programme (ICC, SSITAG and the TWG). The meeting recommendation was to extend the membership period till May 2022, to allow the Ministry of Health to identify new members and filling in the vacancies.

title.narrative: WHO : Data
Community based surveillance system implemented

target.value:
Support measles and rubella case based surveillance including sample collection and transportation reimbursement as per the national guideline and ensuring functionality of the measles laboratory
Conduct quarterly review meeting to strengthen Rota sentinel surveillance
Support Gavi application proposal submission for Measles SIAs and others as required including those for outbreak response
Support activities for Introduction od the 2nd dose of IPV into routine immunization

comment.narrative: ? Continued to the measles, rubella and rotavirus laboratory through ensuring technical support, provision of reagents and supplies. Support the registration of the laboratory with CDC?s International Reagent Resource to ensure sustained supplies of reagents. ? Continued to use the Polio Infrastructure to support measles and rubella case-based surveillance including reporting, active case in facilities, and sample transportation. By epidemiological week 45 in 2021, a total of case-based suspected measles cases and 101 line listed cases were reported. A total of 12 laboratory-confirmed sporadic cases were reported, with no confirm outbreaks and no deaths.

title.narrative: New specific VPD surveillance system implemented or integrated

target.value:
Support measles and rubella case based surveillance including sample collection and transportation reimbursement as per the national guideline and ensuring functionality of the measles laboratory
Conduct quarterly review meeting to strengthen Rota sentinel surveillance
Support Gavi application proposal submission for Measles SIAs and others as required including those for outbreak response
Support activities for Introduction od the 2nd dose of IPV into routine immunization

comment.narrative: Measles case-based surveillance ongoing with cases investigated and samples collected (xxx), however no outbreak reported in 2021 for Measles but reports on rubella outbreak 2021 have been recorded. Lab remains functional, reagents are available in country. The lab has also been registered with the International Reagent Resource of the CDC. Support continues for Rota sentinel surveillance, first quarter review meeting conducted in March 2021 with participation from all key staff. GAVI Measles application to be submitted by the end of June. IPV2 introduction planned to commence 1 July 2021

title.narrative: AEFI causality assessments conducted

target.value: Facilitate quarterly AEFI committee meetings

comment.narrative: ? Strengthened AEFI surveillance by providing technical support in terms of trainings, meetings and support to field investigations and causality assessments. Used Covid-19 vaccination funding to further strengthen the AEFI Surveillance System. Through this strengthened system, total of 502 minor and 26 serious AEFIs were reported for Covid-19 vaccination alone in 2021 (https://app.powerbi.com/view?r=eyJrIjoiYzZkMGRmYjQtZTQzYS00MTVjLWEzNzItMDI0YzU4NGQ5NjJlIiwidCI6ImY2MTBjMGI3LWJkMjQtNGIzOS04MTBiLTNkYzI4MGFmYjU5MCIsImMiOjh9

target.value: Facilitate quarterly AEFI committee meetings

comment.narrative: ? Strengthened AEFI surveillance by providing technical support in terms of trainings, meetings and support to field investigations and causality assessments. Used Covid-19 vaccination funding to further strengthen the AEFI Surveillance System. Through this strengthened system, total of 502 minor and 26 serious AEFIs were reported for Covid-19 vaccination alone in 2021 (https://app.powerbi.com/view?r=eyJrIjoiYzZkMGRmYjQtZTQzYS00MTVjLWEzNzItMDI0YzU4NGQ5NjJlIiwidCI6ImY2MTBjMGI3LWJkMjQtNGIzOS04MTBiLTNkYzI4MGFmYjU5MCIsImMiOjh9)

target.value: Facilitate quarterly AEFI committee meetings

comment.narrative: Meeting planned for 1st quarter but not held as a quorum could not be formed however planned second quarter meeting to be held 25 June 2021

title.narrative: Data desk review or triangulation analysis performed (coverage, surveillance, operational, others)

target.value:
Conduct national mapping of zero dose children; data analysis and data triangulation and feedback to inform decision making
Conduct rapid assessments of EPI services in counties contributing to 50% of zero dose children and provide evidence based recommendations to improve coverage
Recommendations shared in the during the bi-annual EPI Review meetings at state and national level

comment.narrative: National mapping, with data analysis conducted with counties that had highest numbers of zero dose children identified along with enormous number of missed children. Plans to accelerate immunizations been discussed at the EPI TWG, however objective is to reduce the zero dose by 20% in the 3rd and 4th quarter however funding remains major constraint for implementation

title.narrative: Bottleneck analysis (BNA) performed

target.value:
Conduct national mapping of zero dose children; data analysis and data triangulation and feedback to inform decision making
Conduct rapid assessments of EPI services in counties contributing to 50% of zero dose children and provide evidence based recommendations to improve coverage
Recommendations shared in the during the bi-annual EPI Review meetings at state and national level

comment.narrative: The national mapping of zero dose children was conducted, data was analyzed , presented during EPI review meeting. The recommendations were used in the development and the PSR document that is developed and will be submitted to Gavi for funding of immunization services, including targeting the counties with high number of zero dose. the same data are used in the development of Measles follow up campaign application in which counties with high number of zero dose children will have special strategies to reach the children, with with the MCV and other antigens during the campaign. The recommendations on zero dose children are put into the development of the above documents, and the finalization or the result will be seen when the two proposal are implemented .

title.narrative: WHO : Health Information Systems (Data)

Follow up action based on the data support requirements and further monitoring of impact of the support on RI reporting activities and meet standard indicators (completeness, timeliness and reduced discrepancy between levels of reporting

target.value: Orgnise training on DHIS2 for the national EPI TWG and 10 operational hubs

comment.narrative: Training done in Feb 2021 and all ten state EPI managers and key personnel involved in data management from MOH and other organization Focus was on reducing discrepancy and ensuring data submission

target.value: Orgnise training on DHIS2 for the national EPI TWG and 10 operational hubs

comment.narrative: Training done in Feb 2021 and all ten state EPI managers and key personnel involved in data management from MOH and other organization Focus was on reducing discrepancy and ensuring data submission

title.narrative: UNICEF : Demand Promotion & ACSM
Roadmap for harmonization of community engagement through the social workforce developed and ready for roll out.

target.value: Contribute to harmonization of the social mobilization workforce activities at the community level towards effective demand generation activities

comment.narrative: Activity ongoing, MOH with support of GAVI sourced a consultancy firm to conduct mapping of ICMN and BHI. Desk reviews have been completed at all levels with data collection ongoing. Also, UNICEF contributed towards the development of concept note, reviewed of data collection tools and provided relevant data for the mapping exercise. Once the report is completed, UNICEF will work together with the MOH to use recommendations from the mapping exercise to develop harmonized communication strategy for demand generation activities in the country.

title.narrative: Review and refinement of risk communication and community engagement (RCCE) working group TOR, membership and role to strengthen RCCE presence and integration with the key pillars of response/decision making

target.value: Strengthen MOH capacity in conducting RCCE sub-working group meetings to bolster demand generation actors coordination at national and subnational levels

comment.narrative: Process is underway for review and refinement of risk communication and community engagement (RCCE) working group TOR, membership and role to strengthen RCCE presence and integration with the key pillars of response/decision making, New members and CSOs have been added in RCC pillars in order to expand the scope of RCC activities for routine immunization.

title.narrative: Mentorship plan with clear timelines developed

target.value: Support mentorship of the state communication officers to enhance their skills in planning, coordinating, monitoring and evaluation of community mobilization activities at sub-national level to overcome vaccine demand-related barriers in high risk communities

comment.narrative: The national and state C4D team are continuing mentorship of the state communication officers to enhance their skills in planning, coordinating, monitoring and evaluation of community mobilization activities at sub-national level to overcome vaccine demand-related barriers in high risk communities. The states communication officers have been involved very closely in planning, execution, and monitoring of state level communication activities for routine immunization and SIAs. They have been provided hands on/ on job support to improve the skills and build capacity on these key areas. The state communication officers have been working very closely with C4D officers, state EPI managers and partners in engaging communities during the microplanning for routine immunization which proved to be helpful in enhancing community engagement and thereby addressing the demand side issues for immunization.

title.narrative: 100% demand generation strategy implemented across all FER locations (54 counties) with 10 trained EPI health promotion officers and EPI managers and all vaccinators trained in inter-personal communication in 54 counties.

target.value:
1. Cascade the national demand generation strategy across former 10 hubs and 80 counties through state hub demand generation workshops
2. Conduct formative studies in FER locations on knowledge, attitude and practices especially with returnees, pastoral, internally displaced and urban poor communities to generate evidence to inform demand generation programming in 54 FER counties.
3. Training of Govt. state health promotion officers, EPI managers and CSOs on evidence based demand generation methodologies.
4. Support in development of evidence based demand genertaion communication materials and job aides as co-lead of the demand generation working group for EPI

comment.narrative: The task of cascading the national demand generation strategy across former 10 hubs and 80 counties through state hub demand generation workshops have been conducted in all states as the states have prepared states communication plans. Community Rapid Assessments (CRA) exercises was held in FER locations on knowledge, attitude and practices especially with returnees, pastoral, internally displaced and urban poor communities to generate evidence to inform demand generation programming in 54 FER counties. Training, orientation, mentoring of govt. state health promotion officers, EPI managers and CSOs on evidence-based demand generation methodologies done at all 10 states. Support provided to development of evidence based demand generation communication materials and job aides as co-lead of the demand generation working group for EPI which includes production of 25000 flip books, 20,000 reminder slips and 100,000 stickers for enhancing community engagement for routine immunization.

target.value:
1. Cascade the national demand generation strategy across former 10 hubs and 80 counties through state hub demand generation workshops
2. Conduct formative studies in FER locations on knowledge, attitude and practices especially with returnees, pastoral, internally displaced and urban poor communities to generate evidence to inform demand generation programming in 54 FER counties.
3. Training of Govt. state health promotion officers, EPI managers and CSOs on evidence based demand generation methodologies.
4. Support in development of evidence based demand genertaion communication materials and job aides as co-lead of the demand generation working group for EPI

comment.narrative: The task of cascading the national demand generation strategy across former 10 hubs and 80 counties through state hub demand generation workshops have been conducted in all states as the states have prepared states communication plans. Community Rapid Assessments (CRA) exercises was held in FER locations on knowledge, attitude and practices especially with returnees, pastoral, internally displaced and urban poor communities to generate evidence to inform demand generation programming in 54 FER counties. Training, orientation, mentoring of govt. state health promotion officers, EPI managers and CSOs on evidence-based demand generation methodologies done at all 10 states. Support provided to development of evidence based demand generation communication materials and job aides as co-lead of the demand generation working group for EPI which includes production of 25000 flip books, 20,000 reminder slips and 100,000 stickers for enhancing community engagement for routine immunization.

title.narrative: KAP study conducted

target.value: Revise state communication strategies based on findings from community rapid asessment (CRA).

comment.narrative: Three rounds of community rapid assessments have been conducted in 2020-21 in order to identify behavioral drivers, community coping mechanisms and communication channels in all 10 states of the country which includes a separate section on identifying knowledge, attitude and behavior patterns of the community on routine Immunization in South Sudan. As per the findings 97% of the households were aware of vaccination also 94% of the respondents were aware of the importance of vaccinations and 98% of the respondents were willing and know the time and venue of vaccination whereas 90% of the respondents surveyed got their eligible immunized with all due antigens.

title.narrative: State communication officers receive necessary skills in planning, coordination, monitoring & evaluation of community mobilization activities at the subnational level

target.value: Support mentorship of the state communication officers to enhance their skills in planning, coordinating, monitoring and evaluation of community mobilization activities at sub-national level to overcome vaccine demand-related barriers in high risk communities

comment.narrative: UNICEF C4D support to MOH, all 12 communication officers (2 National and 10 state level) received capacity building on effective implementation of demand generation activities at all levels. The communication officers in particular did not only support the coordination of demand creation activities for RI (including training and supervision), but also coordinated COVID 19 vaccination especially as it is now transitioning into RI and provide technical support in the on-going campaign in Phase III across all the states. UNICEF continued to pay incentives for 12 (2 national and 10 state) communication officers at both national and state levels. As the proposed integration of the communication officers into the payroll of MOH has not yet happened, continuing incentives to the communication officers may need to be considered in order to retain them. State communication Officers also benefited from on - the- job training from C4D country team through regular supportive supervision visits. In all, 17 supportive supervision visits were conducted to states including Upper Nile, Unity state, Jonglei, Northern Bahar El Gazel, Western Bahr El Gazel WES and EES. In line with C4D's plan to use evidence informed approaches to increase uptake of vaccines, human - centred design (HCD) workshops are being held in the country. Some communication Officers are part of the on-going training. First workshop was conducted on 5th October 2021 with a follow-up training HCD methodology on November 9th to 10th 2022. The state communication officers are expected to co-facilitate HCD approach in various states and counties. All these efforts are meant to improve the skills of communication officers

title.narrative: Technical support provided for harmonization of social mobilization work force across key sectors

target.value: Contribute to harmonization of the social mobilization workforce activities at the community level towards effective demand generation activities

comment.narrative: UNICEF is providing technical support for harmonization of social mobilization work force across key sectors. The list of ICMN Community Mobilisers per GAVI FER locations has been updated and shared MOH and even helped GAVI in identifying a technical experts to fast track the work for mapping of CMs in order to avoid duplication of resources and manpower. This is work under progress

title.narrative: Risk communication plan developed

target.value: Strengthen MOH capacity in conducting RCCE sub-working group meetings to bolster demand generation actors coordination at national and subnational levels

comment.narrative: UNICEF supported MOH in streamlining RCCE TWG as a co-ordinating body to bring all partners on demand generation activities in the country. A total of 14 RCCE TWG meetings have been conducted at national level to discuss demand generation activities for all immunisation activities including RI, OBR, measles, and Td. The RCCE TWG regularly provided feedback to the EPI TWG, COVAX TWG and SIA TWG on the progress of activities conducted. States including Northern Bahar El Gazel, WBG, EES, Lakes and WES have established their subnational level RCCE TWG to ensure proper co-ordination of activities..

title.narrative: Communication and social mobilization strategy developed

target.value: Revise state communication strategies based on findings from community rapid asessment (CRA).

comment.narrative: UNICEF supported all the states to develop state level communication and social mobilization plan in collaboration with National and state EPI team. The Demand generation plans have been integrated into the national and states annual EPI work plan. To ensure the implementation of the plan, all state communication Officers and state C4D officers were given technical guidance on on how to carry out key communication activities across the states.

title.narrative: CDC : Programme Implementation/Coverage & Equity

? Capability for 100% of the 66 new state officers, county EPI supervisors from 54 counties, and the implementing partners in conducting supportive supervision is built. This activity links with two activities in the FER that CDC will be spearheading. ? 100% of the state officers, county supervisors, and facility vaccinators can develop facility level micro plans. ? 100% of the data officers send timely and complete monthly reports to the national level ? Vaccine utilization data reported to the national level by all cold chain technician All these activities link with activities covered under the HSS and FER funds

To cover the travel costs and field per diem for MoH/EPI mentors, Project Advisor, 3 regional officers who will support the Technical Advisor to provide on-going mentoring for the 66 new state-level officers, 54 county EPI officers, coordinate with Implementing partners, and frontline health workers.

title.narrative: John Snow, Inc. : Programme Management - General
At least 70% of planned state coordination meetings held; implementation of annual workplans tracked; course correction measures provided as needed.

target.value: Support South Sudan Ministry of Health priority states in strengthening the functionality of monthly coordination platforms/mechanism in 10 states (through EPI Coordination Committee meetings)

comment.narrative: State EPI managers held 32.5% (26 meetings) of the expected 80 Coordination Committee meetings. Workplan activity implementation was discussed and documented though minutes and action items, for decision-making. Out of the 116 meeting action points captured, 75% of the action points were implemented. Reasons for lack of implementation include: funding, timing of competing priorities/activities like micro-planning and PIRI, and gaps in state EPI leadership. JSI assists in the tracking, review and feedback for correction of Coordination Committee meeting notes at the national level. JSI observes action point implementation using a meeting tracker, which monitors these monthly meetings per state. States identified several challenges/observations as barriers to achieving their targets. These include: (1) Upper Nile State did not hold any meetings due to disallowance by authorities & security concerns, (2) Lakes State EPI Manager was changed and there was no dedicated replacement, (3) Previous EPI Manager in Northern Bahr El Ghazal was replaced by the successor who has yet to conduct these meetings, and (4) many competing priorities (outbreaks, COVID-19 engagement, and flooding).

title.narrative: State level review: At least 80% of states (8 states) and 1 administrative area reviewed their annual immunization workplan and budget, including interventions to reach zero dose DPT1 children and missed opportunities

target.value: Support MOH in reviewing annual workplans during state and national level review meetings in at least 8 states and 1 administrative area.

comment.narrative: The state level review meeting was not conducted as planned due to funding constraints and poor Internet connectivity. The Ministry of Health has advised pushing this activity until Q1 2022. However, preparation for these review meetings will be done in Q4 2021. The earmarked funds for these meetings will be used in Q1 2022 for orientation of the stakeholders on the next HSS grant during the review meetings including counties, states and the national level. JSI will support the National EPI Department in preparing the state EPI teams to convene the state level review meetings at each state capital, with their respective counties. JSI's specific tasks include: (1) coordinating communication to the states, (2) coordinating the request of funds from WHO, (3) reviewing and updating the review template, (4) collecting and analyzing the status of March 2021 review recommendations implementation particularly for coverage of zero dose children, and (5) reviewing and updating the agenda. We request that this carried over milestone be amended to submit an update in December 2021. JSI will send an email to the Gavi SCM to agree on the revised milestone.

title.narrative: At least 70% of planned state coordination meetings held; implementation of annual workplans tracked; course correction measures provided, as needed

target.value: Support MOH in reviewing annual workplans during state and national level review meetings in at least 8 states and 1 administrative area.

title.narrative: States are prepared for Q1 2022 statelevel review meetings, through JSI technical support (which includes coordinating communication, funds, anda genda items)

target.value: Support South Sudan Ministry of Health priority states in strengthening the functionality of monthly coordination platforms/mechanism in 10 states (through EPI Coordination Committee meetings)

title.narrative: PEF - Independent Consultant

1. Work closely with the Gavi Senior Country Manager (SCM) and the relevant Country Team, the Ministry of Health and further extend relationships with grant recipients, donors, Alliance and strategic partners 2. Facilitate the functioning of the Inter-agency Coordination Committee (ICC), South Sudan Immunisation Technical Advisory Group (SSITAG), EPI TWG and other structures currently in place for oversight and coordination of immunisation activities 3. Act as an in-country focal point to support Ministry of Health EPI department in developing the long-term strategic plan, including supporting data collection and analysis, stakeholder and partner consultations and follow up on in-country deliverables 4. Support the Government of South Sudan to plan and coordinate key priorities and deliverables among the strategic programme partners 5. Provide ongoing support to the EPI manager related to strategic efforts towards harmonisation, integration, when feasible, and ensure complementarities
